text: My mom has purchased shrimp and sometimes scallops (real genuine scallops) from Cecil for years (like over a decade). He parks at Cottage Hill and Schillinger, so convenient. text: This is the only place I buy seafood now, if you haven’t been, you definitely need to. For quality of product, it literally can’t be beat!  They get everything in fresh, they steam it for you if you want, and their crawfish brine is TO DIE FOR!  They also sell the brine for you to cook on your own at home if you’d rather. They have all the spices to do Cajun right, and the staff couldn’t be more helpful or knowledgeable. Joe is always at the counter and you’ll never meet anyone who knows more about seafood. I can’t rave about this place enough, it’s clean, convenient, and better freshness and quality of seafood in Birmingham, you’ll never find!

name: P F (Passiflora)
text:
Fresh Gulf seafood!
Visited today for the first time. Got fast, friendly service, fresh gulf oysters, ready-to-cook crab cakes. Fish custom filleted in the back while I waited. They even gave me samples of freshly cooked fish and oysters.

name: Stacey Brown
text:
I decided to shop local instead of Whole Foods on hwy 280 in search for whole red snapper. They did have red snapper and was able to prepare it for cooking just as Whole Foods does. Their prices are higher than Whole Foods which wasn't a deal breaker. We purchased 2 whole red snapper at $52.61 and a half of filet of Salmon at $27.13. They politely provided ice for the ride as requested. Before we could get home we started smelling a foul smell from the fish. This has never happened on our ride from Whole Foods which is a farther distance. We are not fish experts by any means- just seafood lovers. Anyone who does fish would know that one of the fish that we were sold was spoiled and should not be eaten. Definitely an owner or employee of a seafood market would know this. I did some research to determine the signs of bad fish (Spoiled fish has an unpleasant, sharp smell of trimethylamine (bad fish) and rot. Eyes of fresh fish are bulging and shiny. Eyes of old fish are cloudy and sunken into the head. Gills and fins of fresh fish are moist).
One of our fish had all of the signs listed (I posted pictures of the two snappers we were sold).
So what was meant for dinner for two is now dinner for one for @ $52.61.
This was my first and last experience at the Hoover Seafood Market.

name: Byrdman Byrdman

The pricing is VERY reasonable especially to be as fresh as it is! And the individual pre packaged cocktail sauces..  PROBABLY has something to do with the PANDEMIC and helps to spread less germs. Place is VERY clean and staff is amazing and will treat you like family as soon as you walk in the door! I will FOREVER recommend this FINE family owned small business! ❤️

name: Rusty Ashmore
text: I didn't realize they served steamed shrimp to go until I saw a post on Facebook.  I decided to give it a try and ordered the medium shrimp for 1 which comes with a piece of corn and new potatoes 1/2 lb shrimp for 8.99 + tax.  They offer mild medium or hot so I did medium (should have ordered hot).  Corn and potatoes had a nice flavor, shrimp was really a mix of small and medium so kinda disappointing tbh.  I was asked if I wanted cocktail sauce and butter, I said just cocktail.  Big mistake it cost .50 plus really wasn't enough go figure 🤔  wonder what the butter cost?  Very friendly staff and it was tasty.  If you're after steamed seafood in Foley to take out this is a good place.  I suggest already having your cocktail sauce and butter at home.

name: Robin palisades
text: I met the owner at the Foley farm market and we had a long chat about shrimp, freshness etc. He promised me that the Royal Reds were "sweet" and my satisfaction was guaranteed with my purchase. I bought 2 pounds of frozen Reds, 2 filets of Grouper and 2 filets of snapper....the fish was frozen as well and he promised that it was fresh. When I took it home and cooked the shrimp for dinner, it was SO fishy, by far not "sweet" as he described. The next night we thawed and cooked the Grouper, it did not smell fishy before we cooked it,  but it smelled and tasted terrible after cooking. I brought all of the cooked and still frozen food back for a refund and he refused. He said that he would only exchange. Bad business, bad policy, bad fish and shrimp, period.

resp.text: Hi Robin! As you have described, we sell a lot of flash frozen seafood to ensure freshness! Royal Reds are a sweeter shrimp by reputation! I’m sorry you did not enjoy the seafood but as you have stated in the review, the seafood was not fishy or smelly as of purchase only after your preparation! We gladly offered you something else, on us, when you came back in as we always have since opening and we still do! I’m sorry you did not enjoy the seafood and hope you try us again 😁

name: Luan Brashaw
text: I have recently moved to the area and Publix is a brand that is familiar and trusted. Publix at The Bray is like all Publix, friendly, polite team members waiting to help with a smile. This fairly new store offers all the same grocery brands and deals as my "old" Publix. I was delighted to find a self-serve hot bar and salad bar in addition to their deli. I believe they even have a seating area upstairs.  All employees were masked which is becoming more unusual since the COVID vaccine has become more available to the general public. Well-lit, amply spaced aisles add to the overall pleasant shopping experience. I look forward to frequenting this store AND the shopping complex it is a part of while I live in this area.

name: J L
text: I have had one too many disappointing events at this location. Twice I had to complain about the deli. Once the employees were not wearing gloves the second time I was given raw food. This time I went to get batteries. There was a 25% off coupon on the hangers for the batteries. All the Duracell brand. 4 pack 8 pack so forth. I get to the register with my 4 pack and they ring up normal price. I ask about. A young lady goes and checks then comes back and tells me it only for the bigger packs. Then why is it on all the pack sizes? They must of run out of room is what I am told. The cashier was very nice, apologetic but the other lady although not rude was not willing to solve the issue but was insistent on me paying full price. Needless to say although I would normally just pay decided not too and left. This was not a customer mistake but store level which should of been handled better.

I'm standing in the freezing cold weather and when I told the lady I tried to call way before 2 but noone would answer the phone so if she had 30ty pounds for this lady why couldn't she manage to let me buy 3 pounds and it was Christmas Eve and she really needs to be a better employee for yall so you don't loose customers because I will never buy anything from this place again . Ok rant over just thought I'd share with the people of Bay Minette  that this lady was rude and did not have the spirit of Christmas or even had a kind heart for people wanting to pay money for the seafood .. I said I wasn't told and she proceeds to move things off the counter and snarky says that there was a sign right here.  I will not be back. Customer service is horrible. name: JA Spencer
text: Best seafood market in huntsville. The owner drives to the coast 3 times a week to keep their offerings FRESH. you'll be hard pressed to find a better in northern AL.

name: KellyMarie Conlon
text: Picked up two pounds of Royal Reds and 4 large lobster tails. It was delicious, and the price on the lobster tails was unbeatable.  Turned out excellent.

name: Keith Dugas
text: Great boiled crawfish from Louisiana. Other items a bit pricey.

name: Sharon Heinz (Profit Wise Accounting)
text: Great selection!   Amazing shrimp and salmon!

name: Ina Scott
text: Always has the best selections of fresh fish. And out go to for crawfish!

name: Nick Vivian
text: Best fresh seafood in Huntsville! Great selection with superb customer service. They will order anything you need.

name: Diana Graf
text: just ordered last weekend, WOW, so good, very clean tasting, great size, more big than small.  38 lb sack.  PERFECT, thank you so much for making the crawfish run to Lafayette.  David and Diana Graf Madison, AL

name: K P
text: Went in twice, smelled so bad, had to leave. Fresh seafood should not smell like this.

name: Gopala Myneni
text: Very co-operative in service. Fresh food. Many choices.Highly recommend

name: B I
text: I bought grouper from this location ysterday afternoon (2/09/18) and it got me extremely ill.  When I called the store and advised the lady what the fish did to me and my boyfriend and I was just giving a courtesy call for her to check their grouper this morning the lady was very combatant and told me I must not know how to cook. After insulting me she then told me to bring the remaining grouper back in the get a credit.  I advised I am not pulling the fish out of the trash and driving it over 30 minutes.  I told her I just wanted to check the fish cause I didn't want to get anyone else sick.  Her rudeness is why I'm leaving a negative review.  I understand selling bad fish can happen but her personal attack on my ability to cook was unnessary when I cook fish all the time.  I will NEVER visit this place again!!!!! Consumers please check your fish since she didn't seem concerned.

name: John Smith (Outlands Electronics)
text: Love this place. Great seafood. Nice owners.

name: Ryan Duerr
text: Their store was very clean. The quality of their fish and shrimp is unmatched. Love the gumbo!

name: James Hamilton
text: A little pricey, but best place I have found in Huntsville for quality shrimp. Plan on going back and trying some fresh fish.

name: Chloe Funkhouser
text: Their seafood is fresh quality!!  I won't go anywhere else!!  And the service is great!  They care about their customers.

name: Shelley Fraser

name: Bob Gibson
text: There is something about a new Publix that makes you want to shop there. The meats, seafood, fruits and vegetables all looked good. I only purchased veggies and spicy wings this time. The beer and wine selection is good and chilled in some cases. Clean store and friendly staff. You won't be disappointed and if something is not right Publix will make to make it right. That is the Publix difference!

resp.text: Thanks for your kind feedback and for shopping with us, Bob! ¤Angel

name: Girli Green
text: This was possibly the worst shopping experience I have EVER had. The cashier and the gentleman that helped bag my groceries were pleasant. He was even friendly. My thoughts on every single other employee I encountered would require a long tirade of profanity. I will NEVER go back there. I can barely believe Publix would allow this crew to operate their store. Such a shame.

resp.text: Can you please reach out to our Customer Care line: 1-800-242-1227, or private message us on Facebook here: https://www.facebook.com/publix/, and we will be happy to help get this concern addressed with the Store Manager. ➳Cinthya

name: Winston Smith
text: Shopped at the Publix at the Morgan Road Plaza on 6/1/2021 at about 5:30pm. From the deli, we bought sushi and "Quick Shrimp Bites". While the sushi was really pretty good, the shrimp bites is why there is a "1 star" rating. My wife and I ate in the parking lot. The shrimp was cold as were the potato wedges. I really cannot understand how a brand new, flagship, Publix  serves cold shrimp and potatoes that were supposed to be hot.

resp.text: Can you please reach out to our Customer Care line: 1-800-242-1227, or private message us on Facebook here: https://www.facebook.com/publix/, and we will be happy to help get this concern addressed with the Store Manager. ➳Cinthya

name: Michael Ray
text: Love the new store and layout. Always a good shopping experience.

resp.text: Thanks for the love and for shopping with us, Michael! ¤Angel

name: James Hall
text: Wonderful offering of seafood and seafood spices. They will steam fresh stuff while you wait.   There are other odds and ends in the freezer.  A staple of the area that has been there decades!

resp.text: Thanks James for the awesome review! Come back and see us soon!!

name: Meggin Papke
text: Super friendly, small business feel with outstanding fresh seafood. We'd recommend the royal red shrimp or red snapper, if in season. They even steam the shrimp for if you'd like. They also make their own seafood dips, cocktail sauce and soups. We went back 3x during our 2 week stay.

resp.text: Thanks Meggin! Hope you get to come back soon!

name: Lisa Allen
text:
Perdido Bay Seafood re-opened after Hurricane Sally hit the area. Come in and see all the new improvements. Open Monday-Saturday 8 AM-5:30 PM. Sundays open 11 AM-5:30 PM. Shrimp steamer shuts down at 5 PM.
Do not confuse Perdido Bay Seafood with Perdido Key Seafood/Fisherman's Corner. We are not affiliated, sell product to them, nor recommend them. There is only ONE seafood market in Perdido, and it's this one- PERDIDO BAY SEAFOOD.

resp.text: That's right!! Thanks for keeping everybody posted!

name: Steve West
text: We love this place!  The people are as nice and genuine as they come.  The prices are good but the quality even better.  We stocked up on the finest, freshest grouper and snapper filets we've ever seen to take home with us.  I'd recommend this business to anyone needing fresh seafood.

resp.text: Thanks Steve!! Hope to see you back this way soon!!!

name: Eric Ribecky
text: Loved my visit!  We are staying nearby for a week of spring break, and so had to stop in for some local fresh seafood.  You can't beat the quality, prices, or people at Perdido Bay Seafood!  The nice ladies working behind the counter pointed me to the best fish they had, gave me info on picking up crab bait, and really made me feel welcome.  I'll be heading back there all week!

resp.text: Thanks Eric!!! See you soon!

name: Jeff Fink
text: Great people, prices skittle high. Quality excellent

name: John Bratton
text: Good assortment. Friendly people. The Royal Red Shrimp was succulent. We cooked it up Cajun style. As always, my wife is a culinary hero.

name: Patricia Ortega
text: Friendly staff and a great variety of fresh seafood.

resp.text: Thanks Patricia! We really appreciate you taking the time to give us an awesome review!!

name: Jeff Fink
text: Great people, prices skittle high. Quality excellent

name: Thomas Wyse
text: Friendly service and fresh fish at great prices!

name: Trish Bolton
text: Love the people and the seafood. Super fresh! And the crawfish are amazing! They go fast so order ahead and reserve.

resp.text: So glad you enjoyed those crawfish!! See you soon!

name: Healing Earth Ceramics
text: Love this seafood market and will return over and over when in the area.  It was highly suggested we try the trigger fish and we were not disappointed.  Salt, pepper and bronzed it in butter and it was excellent.  During our week here in Perdido Key the best meals we have had have been from the Perdido Bay Seafood Market.  Royal red shrimp, local gulf shrimp, trigger fish, red snapper and fresh made cocktail sauce.  Wish I had taken more pics.  This place made the restaurants a big disappointment. Service was excellent, seafood was fresh and our porch was the best restaurant in town at the best price due to the Perdido Bay Seafood market.

name: Mary Dike
text: Great selection and prices!! Their dips are amazing!

resp.text: Thanks Mary for the awesome review! You are a sweetheart! See you again soon!

name: Andrea Edgar
text: This is a good place to pick up some fresh and local seafood. I specifically went here to pick up some gator tail they had in from Louisiana. It was great! They had many fresh shrimp and fish options.

resp.text: Thanks for the review! So glad we had what you were looking for!!!

name: Ken Lister
text: Most well run and best fresh seafood establishment we have ever visited! Highly recommended.

resp.text: Thanks Ken, we appreciate you noticing! See you soon!

name: Brian Johnson
text: Excellent selection of fresh and frozen seafood. The staff was so helpful when we were making our selections. Should have taken a photograph. The shrimp were huge and very tasty.

resp.text: Thank you!! We hope to see you soon!

name: Brandi Frederick
text: Always the freshest seafood.  Their homemade dips are delicious!  Wonderful family who owns and operates this great seafood market.

resp.text: Thanks Brandi!!! Our loyal customers like you are what makes us great!!

We love this place every winter..we stay just over the bridge so gosh no need to eat out every night...
Try steam our shrimp to perfection and we can’t get enough.  Anyone know if they made it through SALLY?

We are concerned!! Please reply!

resp.text: Yes....lots of remodeling! We were closed 6 weeks. Happy to be opened and running full force!

name: John Bratton
text: Good assortment. Friendly people. The Royal Red Shrimp was succulent. We cooked it up Cajun style. As always, my wife is a culinary hero.

name: Barney Welch
text:
Eye lived in Florida 2/3rd of my life. The
People eye met at Perdido Bay Seafood
R true Floridians. Very nice, friendly and
laid back. Act as if they have no worries
in da world. If you meet someone in Florida that has an attitude or is just a
major pain in da butt, they are a "tourist"
from another state. People from other countries r on the most part very nice also.

resp.text: We appreciate the kind words amd the great review! Hope to see you soon!

text: Frequently stop here for seafood. Always have great service and quality seafood.

resp.text: Thank you! We appreciate you and look forward to seeing you next time!

name: Mom of 4
text: This is THE BEST little hidden treasure. Close by, reasonably priced and always so friendly! We come here every trip! They always have a good variety as well as dips and other staples to go along with your next seafood meal! 🦐 🍤 🐠

text: Excellent and I mean excellent seafood corn chowder. Do not miss it. BTW I am not a tourist.

text: 17 October still closed from Hurricane Sally. Not complaining- just letting potential customers know. Hopefully they’ll be back open soon. Saw some work trucks in front.

resp.text: Yep. We were closed for 6 weeks. Running full force now. Thanks for keeping everyone posted!

name: Dave Phelps
text:
They may not be the biggest fresh seafood shop but they are by far the most friendly. They always have great shrimp and fish. This is the first stop my wife and I make when arriving for spring break. 2 lbs of steamed large shrimp will last us 1 day. Then, back we go for another 2 lbs. Their steamed shrimp is delicious with the Louisiana medium seasoning. Can't get enough.
Worth the stop just under the bridge. Enjoy!!!

text: By far the best little place for seafood in the area.  They are always friendly and answer questions.  Love to go there when I am in the area.

text: First time we came ... It was great. My only complaint was the workers. They were a little snappy.

resp.text: We are sorry that you experienced that. Hopefully you will give us another try and see us shine!!

text: Outstanding little local seafood market. No weird, old fish odor. Absolutely fresh. Extremely clean store too!

resp.text: Thanks Dee for the review! Hope to see you back soon!

name: Jenn V
text: This place is a gem. So much to choose from. We bought snapper for tacos, already peeled and deveined gulf shrimp, and snow crab legs that only needed heating. Prices were good and service was friendly.

resp.text: Thanks Jenn! Hope to see you back soon!!

name: Robert Walker
text: Great selection, awesome staff, good prices on fresh seafood.  A little crowded at 4:00 today.  Don't forget your Gambino bread.

name: Tony Lofton
text: Love this place. Ladies are friendly and helpful. Great, fresh selection and one of my favorite stops since moving to P-cola.

name: Robert Berg
text: This is our go-to place for seafood on the entire gulf coast. Have never been in a cleaner spot (you’d never know you were in a fish market), fish and shrimp are extremely fresh and generally priced as well as anyone around. Get some Royal Reds and steam them, boil some Jumbo Gulf Shrimp, add some Stone Crab claws and you’ll be eating like a King. And the folks working here couldn’t be any nicer-go see them for your fresh seafood!

name: Erik Hansen
text: They lady at the front counter was really awesome. she was genuinely cheerful and happy to help us. The food we got was really good priced and we even did some of their steamed shrimp Wow it was the best. If I didn't live in TN I would come back to this shop every day.

name: Thomas Avery
text: Awesome. Freaking. Awesome. We got fresh snapper and shrimp, brought it back to our room, cooked it, and had the freshest, best tasting seafood meal in decades. Highly recommended.

name: Laura Carrick
text: Favorite stop for fresh shrimp and fish when staying in Orange Beach. Small shop, but well stocked and very clean. If you are a shrimp fan, the Royal Reds are amazing and you can have them steamed snd seasoned for you right in the shop.

name: Peggy Neff
text: A hidden treasure under the bridge to Perdido Key!  The seafood comes from the water right to the store!  It doesn't get much better than that!  We ordered Royal Reds peeled, deveined cooked and seasoned!!  Fantastic!  The price was too!!  The variety was plentiful in fish all fresh!! I would recommend it and also the gumbo and oyster stew!!!

name: Lisa
text: The selection of seafood is amazing and fresh off the literal boat - docked right beside the store. Good prices and friendly owners make the experience 5 star. My advice is, always check here first before buying seafood at the grocery store!

name: Sonny Jim
text: Good selection and great staff that were so nice and helpful.

resp.text: Thanls Sonny! See ya soon!

name: Brandon Witmer
text: We are not locals, as we live up in North Georgia, but we were down in Perdido Key for vacation and found this little seafood spot... all I have to say is WOW! The atmosphere at this market was absolutely phenomenal. A bunch of sweethearts. They offer samples of their product before you buy it as well. I absolutely have to recommend the Smoked Salmon (whenever they have it), the homemade Seafood Gumbo (perfect spice and meal size), the Cajun Crawfish and Cajun Crab dips, and of course, the Royal Red Shrimp. That shrimp is LEGIT! 5/5 stars. If we ever come back to Perdido Key, this is the only place we’ll buy our seafood!

name: Trey Wilemon
text: Had a ballgame to watch one night, so I ran out and picked up steamed shrimp, lobster bisque, crab dip and a key lime pie. It was probably our best tasting food on the trip. The shrimp was so fresh with excellent seasoning. We will definitely do this again!

name: JJ George
text: Our favorite seafood market...  Everything is clean, fresh, and delicious!  Try the assorted homemade smoked seafood dips, they are incredible!

name: Eddy Alvarez
text: Lobster bisque soup was delicious. Prices are reasonable. Best seafood market around. Definitely recommend if in the area.

name: Merna Rikard
text: Fresh and local!  Great variety!  Will be back! Note that they are practically under the bridge... so Google maps will confuse you because it thinks the bridge is on the same level as the building... look for the turn-off at the base of the bridge!

name: Scott Wiltberger
text: Absolutely love this place!! We visit the area every year for a week and we are in here everyday. Owners and employees are super friendly and help out with any questions. Look forward to their seafood every year.

name: Mark Christensen

name: Sharon C
text: I have been going there for 12 years. I am so glad the original owner's have returned, 3 years ago I would have given a zero rating, now I am thrilled that Johnny, Joy, and Dan is back. The best place for fresh!!! Seafood. They have their own boats and bring in their own catch. Only place I will get my fresh seafood.

name: Pamela Hawley
text: The place looks clean but what bothered us is that the older lady who served us just reached in with her bare hands to put our shrimp and fish in the bag. She then reached in the till for change right after. So she obviously touches raw fish and money without washing her hands in between. I could see disposable gloves on the counter but apparently she doesn’t care to use them. Won’t be back.

name: Rashida Walker
text: Close to the condo we stayed at. Bought royal red shrimp and snapper. Very fresh. We also picked up some frozen crab for a boil. Would definitely go back.

It will probably be next year but we will be back!

So I went to buy a bag of tangerines. Guess what, when I picked up the bag all the ones on tbe bottom were Green & Fuzzy too. I went back to the mgr and he rolled his eyes and said "what do you want? I check everyday...it happens". That level of rot does Not happen over night and his attitude was the worse. Publix customers Pay More and I dont mind for better quality and service. After 14 yrs shopping at Publix for my Family of 4, I quit and found out that I get quality produce and other things at Piggly Wiggly for half the cost and great service. That's approx $600/month of my money Publix has lost. This particular Publix is not in as affluent an area as the one I used to shopping for 14 years but I would hate to think that the lack of $$ is why the products and service are inferior

3/6/2019

name: Ojas Gokhale
text:
This is such an awesome place with so much history. Founded in 1936, it is one of the longest running restaurants in Birmingham and serves some of the most sumptuous fish and sandwiches. We tried the philly steak and it is by far the best one I have had in Birmingham. We also tried the grilled fish, friends okra, and friend green tomatoes; and they all hit the spot, just right.
Definitely check them out if you like going to the "off the beaten path" kind of places that are authentic to their locality and serve fresh local cuisine.

name: Rikesha Foster
text: This place is usually good, so my mom says. On Wednesday, we stopped by because she wanted some good fried fish. She ordered two pieces of whole, fried whiting. She was very pleased with her order and the fish was fried and seasoned well. We went back on a Friday for the same order. The fish this time, looked like fillets instead of whole pieces, and my mom says it wasn't fresh. In fact, when I picked up a friend in my car later on, he commented on the fishy scent that lingered in the car and noted that cooked fish shouldn't have such a lasting scent. My mom ended up tossing the 2nd order out and vowed not to return.

name: Tracy Jackson
text:
My honey and I went to this restaurant on Friday.  While the ambiance/atmosphere was not what I expected.... Don't judge!  The food was delicious! I'm so looking forward to revisiting this restaurant!  We had the combo platter, the fish we chose was catfish and perch.  Our sides were fries, cold slaw (and I usually don't order cold slaw) because my experience has been bad at every establishment.  But this cold slaw was sooooo good! And baby! The fried tomatoes were just great!  They are cut thin.... But so what! The oysters were small  but still tasted wonderful.  The shrimp was everything!  All this for  UNDER 20.00!!!!!

Thanks for the delicious meal!  A. Stallworth & T. Jackson
